e="preserve">"Omeros" (1990) is the epic work of poetry by Derek Walcott. This epic poem helped Walcott win the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1992. The title refers to the Greek myths about Homer.  The poem refers to characters in the "Iliad" and "Odyssey". But the poem is set on the Caribbean island of St. Lucia where Walcott was born.
This massive, three-hundred-page epic describes contemporary Caribbean life. Walcott's heroes are ordinary men and women who live in the modern world.
